https://rdm.sfb1451.de/data-catalog-subm: Investigating motor and non-motor symptoms affecting outcome in Parkinson’s disease and related disorders.

Preoperative motor deficits and depressive symptoms predict quality of life in patients with Parkinson’s disease at different time points after surgery for subthalamic stimulation: a retrospective study

The cross-linking project X03 focuses on investigating the effects of motor and non-motor symptoms on therapeutic outcomes in patients with Parkinson’s disease and Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus. This first study investigated changes in quality of life in patients with Parkinson's disease after receiving surgery for deep brain stimulation of the subthalamic nucleus.
